title: Ticket #6664: condor_drain -start ... broken?
description:
Testing condor_drain -start ... on e500.chtc.wisc.edu appeared to work well until it was time to finish draining, at which point it didn't.

First step: check if the version of e500 ($CondorVersion: 8.7.8 May 02 2018 BuildID: 439756 $) includes [54682]. It should (that commit went in on April 10), but check the stupid stuff first, right?

Moate writes: 

May  9 17:02:12 e500 sudo:  condor : TTY=unknown ; PWD=/var/log/condor ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/etc/condor/bin/dns_domain_name.sh /etc/condor/ephemeral/dns_domain_name.conf
May  9 17:02:12 e500 sudo:  condor : TTY=unknown ; PWD=/var/log/condor ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/etc/condor/bin/htcondor_config_pull.sh -d /etc/condor
May 10 11:15:58 e500 sudo:  condor : TTY=unknown ; PWD=/var/log/condor ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/etc/condor/bin/dns_domain_name.sh /etc/condor/ephemeral/dns_domain_name.conf
May 10 11:15:58 e500 sudo:  condor : TTY=unknown ; PWD=/var/log/condor ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/etc/condor/bin/htcondor_config_pull.sh -d /etc/condor

These entries indicate a git checkout triggered by
htcondor_reconfig.  A diff of the git changes to the
chtc_htcondor_config repository is attached.

Second step: the attached diff looks unlikely to be the problem, but the condor_reconfig may have been; check to see if we lost the eviction timer there.
remarks:
2018-May-18 13:21:39 by tlmiller:
Prior release notes: 

\item Added the machine attribute \Attr{AcceptedWhileDraining}
(see page~\pageref{acceptedwhiledraining-machine-attribute}),
configuration macro \Macro{DEFRAG\_DRAINING\_START\_EXPR}
(see page~\pageref{param:DefragDrainingStartExpr}),
and command-line option \Opt{-start} to \Condor{drain}
(see page~\pageref{man-condor-drain})
to support running jobs on draining resources.  See
section \ref{sec:SMP-defrag} for details.
\Ticket{6628}

And from the RPM .spec file: 

- HTCondor can run preemptable jobs on machines that are draining

2018-May-21 16:31:01 by tlmiller:
It looks like that version of HTCondor includes the commit in question.

2018-May-30 13:26:25 by tlmiller:
Need to test this in the BaTLab before documenting.

2018-Jun-06 16:46:16 by tlmiller:
Test of "don't test the streams" commit looks good.

2018-Jun-06 16:51:34 by tlmiller:
Should do more extensive testing at some point; discuss that with Moate and also determine when the doc commits should go in.

2018-Jun-12 12:36:53 by tlmiller:
It looks like #6697 won't be resolved by the release, so we can consider documenting / announcing this feature when ToddT returns.

2018-Jun-14 11:33:17 by tlmiller:
ToddT observed that the remaining set of breakage is all old breakage (dating back to when we added retirement), so we should announce this new feature, document it, and then document the existing bugs and that we'll (try to) fix them in the next release.

"Known bugs" should then include #6701.
check_ins:
2018-Jun-14 14:41   Check-in [55064]: (#6659, #6664, #6697, #6701) Release notes. (By Todd L Miller )
2018-Jun-01 15:51   Check-in [55000]: (#6664) Don't cross the streams. (By Todd L Miller )
2018-May-30 13:24   Check-in [54978]: (#6664) Check only jobs which which /aren't/ backfill for their retirement times when computing it. (Not sure we actually want to coordinate retirement times during draining if backfill is active, but that's another ticket.) (By Todd L Miller )
creator: tlmiller
